explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: UNRTDG Subsidiary risks Class: 3, 8, PG I

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not ignite spontaneously on coming into contact with air at normal temperatures

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat LD50 value: 23.1mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 31mg/kg, about 30mg/kg, about 22mg/kg (DFGOT vol.9, 1998). Calculated based on the data above. Since the calculated values was 22.7mg/kg, it was classified to category 2.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1. Based on the description that three among three cases died by dermal administration of 0.2mg/kg and 0.05mg/kg to rabbits (DFGOT (vol.9, 1998)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Lower value was adopted from rat LC50 (4 hours): 0.007mg/L (2.4ppm) (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and 22.4ppm (equivalent 0.0641mg/L) (DFGOT vol.9, 1998). 2.4 ppm was considered as the steam with almost no mist from vapor pressure. And classified as Category 1 by the ppm concentration standard.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the test applied to the skin of the rabbit, from description that inflammatory changes were seen and the serious necrosis (severe necrosis) appeared 1.5 and 15 minutes after apply (DFGOT (9 vol. 1998)), it was judged that there was caustic and was set as Category 1A-1C. [display] It is more desirable to be set as 1A from a viewpoint of safety, when subdivision is necessary to be carried out.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It had corrosiveness to the skin. And there is the description that very severe corneal degeneration was acknowledged in the test applied to the eyes of the rabbits (DFGOT (vol.9, 1998)). So we classified it as Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data. Skin sensitization : We found a description that there was a report of one case in which sensitizing was acknowledged in DFGOT (vol.9, 1998). Moreover, since it is classified into SEN (ACGIH 7th, 2001) according to ACGIH and was classified into Sh (MAK/BAT, 2004) according to DFG, we classified it to be Category 1. Furthermore, DFGOT (vol.9, 1998) has description that severe contact dermatitis was acknowledged in Open Epicutaneous Test which used the guinea pigs.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is the result that the small core examination which used the male rat bone marrow cell of NTP DB (2006) is equivocal, and the result of the micronucleus test which used mouse peripheral blood is negative for a female and equivocal for a male. So it cannot classify according to the shortage of data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (respiratory organs, kidneys); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Because of a description in DFGOT (vol.9, 1998) referring to that effects on respiratory systems were confirmed at concentration within the limits of guidance value of Category 1 through an inhalation exposure test using rats, rabbits, cats, guinea pigs, and mice, and of a description in DFGOT (vol.9, 1998) referring to confirmation of renal damage at a dosage within the limits of guidance value of Category 1 in oral administration studies with rabbits and cats. So it was judged as Category 1 (respiratory organs, kidney). Moreover, it was judged as Category 3 (anesthetic actions) because of a description in DFGOT (vol.9, 1998) referring to that flexion reflex inhibition was confirmed in a inhalation exposure test using rabbits, and of a description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) indicating anesthetic actions as effects on humans.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (respiratory tracts) based on description that dyspnea was observed with concentration within the guidance value range for Category 1 in the inhalation exposure test on rats (DFGOT (vol.9, 1998)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 2 because of a ketone composed of 13 carbon atoms or less.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour EC50=120microg/L of algae (Selenastrum) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, not rapidly degrading (BOD :1%(BUA233, 2001)), though supposed less bioaccumulative(log Kow=0.41(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
